author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) said his fellow party members need to be a bit more harsh in upcoming elections to put an end to political intimidation. After an unsuccessful bid for the vice presidency in November, Walz has shared staunch criticism of Elon Musk and other officials within the Trump administration.  “I'm getting called...
title: Walz: Democrats need to be a ‘little meaner’

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The Trump administration has ramped up its standoff with the courts over tariffs in recent days, with top advisors condemning two rulings that attempted to block tariffs from proceeding as planned. On Thursday, an appeals court temporarily paused an order that would have halted international tariffs.  Despite the ruling in favor of the administration, deputy...
title: Sunday shows preview: Trump, court tariff battle escalates; Senate GOP up next on ‘big, beautiful’ bill

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Democratic National Committee (DNC) Vice Chair David Hogg is seeing his political star rise — along with the number of attacks lobbed at him from both parties.  Hogg has drawn ire and praise from Democrats for his move to get involved in the party’s congressional primaries, part of what he says is an effort to...
title: David Hogg draws attacks from both sides as his star rises

author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump’s Middle East envoy Steve Witkoff said he received a response to the hostage proposal from the Palestinian militant group Hamas, slamming it as “totally unacceptable” and arguing that it will “only” take all sides involved “backward.”  “Hamas should accept the framework proposal we put forward as the basis for proximity talks, which we...
title: Witkoff slams Hamas over 'unacceptable' ceasefire proposal response

author: Sophia Vento
description: The White House on Saturday said it will pull the nomination of tech entrepreneur Jared Isaacman as NASA administrator.  “It’s essential that the next leader of NASA is in complete alignment with President Trump’s America First agenda and a replacement will be announced directly by President Trump soon,” a White House spokesperson told The Hill....
title: Trump pulls nomination for NASA administrator

author: Imran Khalid, opinion contributor
description: The recent U.S. Treasury bond auction's lackluster performance and Moody's downgrade of the U.S. credit rating highlight a growing loss of faith in Washington's fiscal stewardship, with the potential for global economic instability.
title: Bond auction shows Trump's economic house of cards may soon collapse

author: Dustin Massengill
description: A long-time member of the Kentucky General Assembly said she's switching political parties.
title: Long-time Kentucky Democrat switching parties

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Sen. Joni Ernst (R-Iowa) doubled down on a recent quip about Medicaid in a Saturday post on her Instagram story. “Hello, everyone. I would like to take this opportunity to sincerely apologize for a statement that I made yesterday at my town hall,” Ernst said in the clip, with a sarcastic tone.  On Friday, the...
title: Ernst doubles down on Medicaid comment with sarcastic video ‘apology’

author: George Laws Garcia, opinion contributor
description: Puerto Rico is a natural partner in reshoring the medical and pharmaceutical manufacturing industry, and its leaders are working to ensure that efforts do not trap the island in its current territory status but instead enable it to reach its full potential as a future state of the United States.
title: Puerto Rico is Trump’s perfect partner in reshoring

author: Ryan Costello, opinion contributor
description: A number of the president’s cabinet secretaries are Washington outsiders who bring heavyweight private sector resumes to their new roles.
title: Business leaders are reshaping Washington and delivering for taxpayers

author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump is set to meet with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz next week in Washington, marking the first in-person meeting between the two leaders.  Merz, the leader of the center-right Christian Democratic Union (CDU), who was elected as Germany’s leader in early March, is expected to visit Trump at the White House on Thursday, June...
title: Trump to meet with Germany's Merz in Washington next week

author: James D. Zirin, opinion contributor
description: It is baffling what Hegseth intended to accomplish with the purge. We do know that he has accomplished a decided weakening of national security.
title: Hegseth stampedes through the Pentagon

author: Filip Timotija
description: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore (D) advised Democrats to act and learn from President Trump’s “impatience” during his speech at the annual South Carolina Democrats’ Blue Palmetto Dinner Friday night in Columbia, S.C. “I want to be clear: We can and we must condemn Donald Trump’s reckless actions. But we would also be foolish not to...
title: Wes Moore tells Democrats to act with ‘impatience’ amid 2028 chatter

author: Michael Bartiromo
description: The USDA has already approved SNAP waivers for certain states. What do they entail?
title: Which states are looking to ban soda, snack purchases for SNAP recipients?

author: Alex Gangitano
description: A few names are coming into view as people who could lead the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), which all signs suggest will have a big influence even with Elon Musk’s departure from his official government work.  The White House insists no single person will lead DOGE and that every Cabinet secretary and host of...
title: Who could be the next face of DOGE?

author: Jeff Thinnes, opinion contributor
description: Scores of parks across the country have implemented or are transitioning to “cashless” payment systems. This isn’t a glitch in the system. It’s a symptom of a larger, and dangerous, trend.
title: Why would the US government ever refuse the US dollar?

author: Laura Kelly
description: ODESA, Ukraine — In the range of Russian rockets from Ukraine’s occupied Crimean Peninsula, former Secretary of State Mike Pompeo stood in Odesa and called for President Trump to reject recognizing Russian sovereignty over territory it seized by force. Pompeo, who served as secretary of state during Trump’s first term, said if the U.S. recognized...
title: Pompeo warns against US recognizing Russian control over Crimea: 'Mistake of epic proportions'

author: Filip Timotija
description: Veteran air traffic controller Jonathan Stewart affirmed to the public during a recent television appearance that it is “safe to fly,” but added that he would avoid the embattled Newark Liberty International Airport. “It's safe to fly. I would probably avoid Newark until something else is done,” Stewart, a supervisory air traffic controller, said during...
title: Air traffic controller says its ‘safe to fly’ but ‘avoid Newark’

author: Douglas MacKinnon, opinion contributor
description: His voice and his massive platform have the power to move the needle, to open eyes, to shine a light into corners many prefer to remain shrouded in darkness and ignorance.
title: My challenge to Charlamagne tha God

author: Jonathan Turley, Opinion Contributor
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio has issued a new visa restriction policy barring foreign nationals deemed "responsible for censorship of protected expression" in the U.S., in response to the European Union's aggressive efforts at transnational censorship.
title: Marco Rubio declares war on the global censors

author: Filip Timotija
description: Former national security adviser John Bolton argued during a recent interview that nuclear deal negotiations between the U.S. and Iran are “fruitless" and Israel’s potential strikes against Tehran’s nuclear facilities are entirely “warranted.”  “I think we're really at a very important point here, whether, whether Trump is going to try and continue these negotiations, which...
title: Bolton says US-Iran nuclear talks are 'fruitless'

author: Michael Green, opinion contributor
description: Energy Star isn't merely about labels on appliances; it directly impacts operational costs, performance consistency and market competitiveness.
title: Defunding Energy Star will harm small businesses and US competitiveness

author: Addy Bink
description: The park is stunning as-is, but underwater, it feels like a whole new world.
title: This national park is 95 percent underwater: Here’s what it’s hiding

author: Sierra Campbell
description: The Coast Guard found a still-intact ink pen and other items while going through the remains of the Titan submersible.
title: Titan submersible items that survived the implosion

author: Addy Bink
description: You may feel inclined to rush out and purchase a few rolls of one-cent coins and stash them away, either to use to cover oddly-priced purchases or for a potential payout from collectors. Generally speaking, you may not have to do either.
title: Penny production to end: Should you start stocking up?

author: Tom Kiernan, President and CEO of American Rivers
description: Members of Congress need to put public safety first and approve dedicated funding for the regular upkeep, rehabilitation or removal of dams.
title: Public safety crisis: Budget cuts may cause US dams to fail

author: Jordan Perkins
description: When weight loss drugs start to work vary from person to person.
title: How long does it take weight loss drugs to work?

author: Filip Timotija
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth on Friday urged U.S. allies in the Indo-Pacific to increase their defense spending and cooperation with Washington, warning that China poses a "real" and "imminent" threat to the region. "There's no reason to sugarcoat it: the threat China poses is real, and it could be imminent," Hegseth said late Friday at...
title: Hegseth warns Indo Pacific allies: 'The threat China poses is real'

author: Brooke Migdon
description: A year after launching, Qommittee, a national network of drag artists, says it’s just getting started.  The group’s latest project, issued ahead of Pride, is a 43-page manual called the Drag Defense Handbook, documenting how drag performers, organizers and attorneys across the country have fought state bans and threats of violence and harassment — and won.  The...
title: 'Drag is everywhere': Artist network Qommittee is sashaying to stay

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: The push for Harvard to tap into its $53 billion endowment is mounting as the Trump administration escalates its financial assault on the university.   But on multiple fronts, that move would be more difficult than many people realize. Some 80 percent of the money is legally obligated towards certain uses.   Experts say tapping...
title: Harvard faces growing calls to tap into its endowment in Trump fight. It won't be easy

author: Laura Kelly
description: KHERSON, Ukraine – The new Kherson municipal offices are located a few floors belowground, one of the more glaring signs that civilians here are routinely hunted by drones operated by Russian forces about 3 miles away, on the far side of the Dnieper River. Ukrainian forces liberated 30 percent of the region in November 2022,...
title: Russia’s drone ‘safaris’ haunt Ukrainians in front-line city

author: Brett Samuels
description: The White House is increasing its attacks on the judicial branch in the wake of decisions that briefly blocked President Trump’s sweeping tariffs. It’s a battle-tested playbook the administration has used before on a number of fronts with the courts, which have emerged as an even greater bulwark to the president’s policies in his second...
title: Trump White House steps up attacks on courts after tariff ruling

author: Jared Gans
description: President Trump’s approval rating has trended upward one month after poll aggregates at his 100-day mark painted a grim picture for his presidency’s second term. Trump’s approval rating in the Decision Desk HQ/The Hill polling average rose as high as 47.1 percent this past weekend, the highest point it had been in the past two...
title: Trump's approval rating rebounds in DDHQ/The Hill polling average

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: CNN political analyst Maggie Haberman said some White House officials are excited to see Elon Musk exit his role as a special government employee.  The tech giant led the Department of Government Efficiency for 130 days with an objective to downsize federal spending by trillions. Haberman, also a New York Times journalist, said news coverage...
title: Haberman: Trump officials ‘happy’ about Musk’s departure

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Lester Holt hosted his last “NBC Nightly News” show on Friday after a 14 year tenure as its anchor. The highly decorated reporter bid viewers a farewell by reminding them of their core values that guide the team’s coverage. “I'm so grateful for your trust around here,. Facts matter, words matter, journalism matters, and you...
title: ‘Facts matter:’ Lester Holt ends ‘NBC Nightly News’ tenure

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump said Friday he was not aware of Elon Musk’s reported drug use but indicated he was not troubled by it. “No, I wasn’t,” Trump told reporters when asked if he was aware of Musk’s regular drug use. “I think he’s fantastic. I think Elon is a fantastic guy,” Trump added. "I'm not troubled...
title: Trump shrugs off Musk’s reported drug use

author: Andrew Dorn
description: The housing market is facing a record imbalance, with nearly 500,000 more sellers than buyers, according to Redfin.
title: Homesellers now outnumber buyers by half a million: Redfin

author: Sarah Polus
description: Investor Kevin O'Leary seemingly bashed the Trump administration's recent crackdown on Harvard's international student population, calling the actions "stupid" during a Friday Fox News interview. "Harvard's taken a lot of heat for other stuff, but they shouldn't be taking heat for curating amazing cohorts," the "Shark Tank" star said while appearing on "Outnumbered." "These kids...
title: O'Leary bashes Trump's 'stupid' Harvard foreign student crackdown
